snippet: A video posted online Tuesday shows a militant with a knife threatening to kill two Japanese hostages unless the government in Tokyo pays a ransom of $200 million.
abstract: Japanese public sees online video posted by Islamic State showing militant threatening to kill two Japanese hostages, confronting pacifist nation with crisis; Prime Min Shinzo Abe vows to try to save men while also saying he would not give in to terrorist threats.

byline.original: By MARTIN FACKLER and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Martin Fackler reported from Amami, and Alan Cowell from London. Reporting was contributed by Austin Ramzy from Hong Kong; Rukmini Callimachi from San Diego; Jonathan Soble from Kagoshima, Japan; Mohammad Ghannam from Beirut, Lebanon; Edward Wong from Beijing; Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem; and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: A video posted online Tuesday shows a militant with a knife threatening to kill two Japanese hostages unless the government in Tokyo pays a ransom of $200 million.

headline.seo: ISIS Posts Video Demanding Ransom for 2 Japanese Men
